numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I look at the graph.
2. In every major league sport, the percentage of players of color is higher than the percentage of head coaches of color.
3. I wonder if this difference is because the sample size of head coaches is smaller.
4. In MLB, there are 30 managers in total.
5. Each MLB team has 1 manager.
6. Each MLB team has at most 40 players on an expanded roster.
7. MLB has 30 teams.
8. Therefore, MLB has at most 1200 players at one time.
9. The number of managers is much smaller than the number of players.
10. I wonder how much the sample size affects the percentages.
11. If each team had a 1-to-1 manager-to-player ratio, then the percentage of head coaches of color would still be only 20 percent.
12. The issue of a small sample size is also relevant in the other sports.
13. NFL has 32 head coaches.
14. NFL has more than 1500 active players every year.
15. The number of active players gives a higher opportunity for diversity than the number of head coaches.
16. I think that the percentages of diversity are lower among coaches because of availability.
17. The average NFL player career lasts 3.3 seasons.
18. The average NFL head coach career lasts 4.3 seasons.
19. A long career reduces the rate at which positions are filled.
20. Limited availability reduces the rate at which positions are filled.
21. If positions are not filled quickly, then the positions are less likely to become diverse.
